module.name: bare_die
module.keywords: module, chip, bare die, semiconductor, usage view

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the information needed to describe a semiconductor material product that is an integrated circuit component, or that may be a discrete active component, or that may be included as a component in an electronic assembly. Terminal information is supported, including explicit shape data. A bare die usually refers to semiconductor substrates that are traditionally considered protected by a container, called a package.

inscope.li: definition of the usage view of a bare die, including its terminals and shape;
items within the scope of application module Conductivity material aspects, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1756;
items within the scope of application module Elemental geometric shape, ISO/TS 10303-1004;
items within the scope of application module Extended geometric tolerance, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1666;
items within the scope of application module Functional assignment to part, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1674;
items within the scope of application module Network functional usage view, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1705;
items within the scope of application module Non feature shape element, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1706;
items within the scope of application module Part feature function, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1712;
items within the scope of application module Part occurrence, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1715;
items within the scope of application module Physical unit usage view, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1732;
items within the scope of application module Shape composition, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1742;
items within the scope of application module Value with unit extension, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1753.

outscope.li: the design view of a bare die
